alert.note: Alert for Huron; Sanilac; St. Clair; Tuscola (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 7:27PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT HURON...TUSCOLA... SANILAC...AND ST. CLAIR COUNTIES THIS EVENING... HAZARDS...Areas of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to near a quarter of a mile. Temperatures at or below freezing also allow accumulation on untreated roads. A quick inch of accumulation on unpaved surfaces. The larger area of activity extends west to the Tri Cities and Flint resulting in a 1 to 2 hour period of intermittent heavy snow bursts in any one location. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 725 PM EST, areas of heavy snow were located along a and west of a line from near Gagetown to near North Branch to near Romeo and moving east at 40 MPH. THIS AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Melvin around 740 PM EST. Yale, Memphis and Peck around 745 PM EST. Ubly and Argyle around 750 PM EST. Croswell around 800 PM EST. St. Clair, Lexington, Deckerville and Marysville around 805 PM EST. Lakeport and Port Huron around 810 PM EST. Forestville around 815 PM EST. This includes the following highways... I-94 between mile markers 251 and 273. I-69 between mile markers 173 and 199. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution when traveling into or through areas of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and roads conditions make accidents possible. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
